mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, Jane C. Washington to John Augustine Washington III, 1847 December 27
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Washington, Jane Charlotte Blackburn, 1786-1855
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Jane writes, "I saw no white face on Christmas day." She describes giving out provisions and supplies to the enslaved population, a few of whom assembled to hear her read in the morning and at noon. "They conducted themselves very soberly & orderly." Old Jenny thanked her for the "fine dinner." Jane also describes her Christmas with family - skating, setting traps, reading, and eating cakes and apples. Autograph letter signed, 2 pages, with integral address panel, with note that the letter was carried by "Mr. W's servant Edmund who is returning home from Jefferson Cty."
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Slavery
